Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of the New Zealand government, suggesting that they pulled Sky News Australia off the air, when in reality it was a decision made by Sky New Zealand, a private satellite television provider.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the government of New Zealand took action against Sky News Australia.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the government of New Zealand was responsible for pulling Sky News Australia off the air, without considering alternative explanations or further investigating the actual decision-maker, Sky New Zealand.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation, stating that it was an independent decision made by Sky New Zealand and not the New Zealand government.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the government of New Zealand did not take any action against Sky News Australia.
Understate: The claim understates the role of social media and video-sharing platforms in facilitating the spread of far-right propaganda and their alleged failure to act quickly enough to remove copies of the shooter's live video.
Falters at times: The claim falters in accurately representing the events and misleads readers with its attention-grabbing and misleading headline.
